description: At least 350 people were killed and several hundred more are missing after a village was buried by a huge landslip in Afghanistan on Friday.
title: Afghan Village Swept Away by Massive Landslide
title_page: Afghan Village Swept Away by Massive Landslide
text:
Breaking News Emails Get breaking news alerts and special reports. The news and stories that matter, delivered weekday mornings.
At least 350 people were killed and several hundred more are missing and feared dead after a village was buried by a huge landslip in a remote region of Afghanistan on Friday.
One-third of the 1,000 homes in the village of Aabe Barik in the Argun district of the mountainous Badahkshan province were completely covered by mud several feet deep, as heavy rains made access to the region very difficult for rescue teams.
